qas.question: What does the abbreviation OECD expand to?

answers.text: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development

qas.question: What organization was Greek a founding member?
What is Greece's economy classified as?
When did Greece join what is now the European Union?
When did Greece adopt the Euro as its currency?

plausible_answers.text: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development

qas.question: What does the abbreviation OECD shrink to?
What organization was Greek a banned member?
What is Greece's economy forbidden from?
When did Greece leave what is now the European Union?
When did Greece remove the Euro as its currency?

context: Greece is classified as an <a2_0><b7_0>advanced, high-income<b7_0/><a2_0/> economy, and was a founding member of the <a0_0><b5_0>Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development<b5_0/><a0_0/> (<a1_0><b6_0>OECD<b6_0/><a1_0/>) and of the Organization of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation (BSEC). The country joined what is now the European Union in <a3_0><b8_0>1981<b8_0/><a3_0/>. In <a4_0><b9_0>2001<b9_0/><a4_0/> Greece adopted the euro as its currency, replacing the Greek drachma at an exchange rate of 340.75 drachmae per euro. Greece is a member of the International Monetary Fund and of the World Trade Organization, and ranked 34th on Ernst & Young's Globalization Index 2011.
